To print the sizes of all files in the terminal using the `du` command, you can use the following command:

```
du -ah
```

This command displays the sizes of all the files and directories in the current directory and its subdirectories, in human-readable format (e.g., 1K, 1M, 1G).

If you want to sort the output by file size, you can use the following command:

```
du -ah | sort -rh
```

This command sorts the output in descending order of file size, with the largest files listed first.
